azure_container_registry_id.description: The ID of the Container Registry.

azure_container_registry_login_server.description: The URL that can be used to log into the container registry.

azure_container_registry_admin_enabled.description: (Optional) Specifies whether the admin user is enabled. Defaults to false.

azure_container_registry_georeplication_.description: (Required) A location where the container registry should be geo-replicated.
(Optional) Whether zone redundancy is enabled for this Container Registry? Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to false.

azure_container_registry_name.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Container Registry. Only Alphanumeric characters allowed. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_container_registry_sku.description: (Required) The SKU name of the container registry. Possible values are Basic, Standard and Premium.

azure_resource_group_location.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_resource_group_name.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Container Registry. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

tags.description: Tags to assign to the Azure Container Registry.

azure_cosmosdb_account_connection_string.description: A list of connection strings available for this CosmosDB account.

azure_cosmosdb_account_endpoint.description: The endpoint used to connect to the CosmosDB account.

azure_cosmosdb_account_capabilities_name.description: (Required) The capability to enable - Possible values are AllowSelfServeUpgradeToMongo36, DisableRateLimitingResponses, EnableAggregationPipeline, EnableCassandra, EnableGremlin, EnableMongo, EnableMongo16MBDocumentSupport, EnableMongoRetryableWrites, EnableMongoRoleBasedAccessControl, EnableServerless, EnableTable, EnableUniqueCompoundNestedDocs, MongoDBv3.4 and mongoEnableDocLevelTTL.

(Required) The capability to enable - Possible values are AllowSelfServeUpgradeToMongo36, DisableRateLimitingResponses, EnableAggregationPipeline, EnableCassandra, EnableGremlin, EnableMongo, EnableMongo16MBDocumentSupport, EnableMongoRetryableWrites, EnableMongoRoleBasedAccessControl, EnableServerless, EnableTable, EnableUniqueCompoundNestedDocs, MongoDBv3.4 and mongoEnableDocLevelTTL.

(Required) The capability to enable - Possible values are AllowSelfServeUpgradeToMongo36, DisableRateLimitingResponses, EnableAggregationPipeline, EnableCassandra, EnableGremlin, EnableMongo, EnableMongo16MBDocumentSupport, EnableMongoRetryableWrites, EnableMongoRoleBasedAccessControl, EnableServerless, EnableTable, EnableUniqueCompoundNestedDocs, MongoDBv3.4 and mongoEnableDocLevelTTL.

(Required) The capability to enable - Possible values are AllowSelfServeUpgradeToMongo36, DisableRateLimitingResponses, EnableAggregationPipeline, EnableCassandra, EnableGremlin, EnableMongo, EnableMongo16MBDocumentSupport, EnableMongoRetryableWrites, EnableMongoRoleBasedAccessControl, EnableServerless, EnableTable, EnableUniqueCompoundNestedDocs, MongoDBv3.4 and mongoEnableDocLevelTTL.

azure_cosmosdb_account_consistency_level.description: (Required) The Consistency Level to use for this CosmosDB Account - can be either BoundedStaleness, Eventual, Session, Strong or ConsistentPrefix.

azure_cosmosdb_account_enable_automatic_.description: (Optional) Enable automatic failover for this Cosmos DB account.

azure_cosmosdb_account_geo_location_fail.description: (Required) The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists. Changing this causes the location to be re-provisioned and cannot be changed for the location with failover priority 0.

(Required) The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists. Changing this causes the location to be re-provisioned and cannot be changed for the location with failover priority 0.

azure_cosmosdb_account_geo_location_loca.description: (Required) The name of the Azure region to host replicated data.
(Required) The name of the Azure region to host replicated data.

azure_cosmosdb_account_kind.description: (Optional) Specifies the Kind of CosmosDB to create - possible values are GlobalDocumentDB, MongoDB and Parse. Defaults to GlobalDocumentDB. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_cosmosdb_account_max_interval_in_s.description: (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated. The accepted range for this value is 5 - 86400 (1 day). Defaults to 5. Required when consistency_level is set to BoundedStaleness.

azure_cosmosdb_account_max_staleness_pre.description: (Optional) When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the number of stale requests tolerated. The accepted range for this value is 10 – 2147483647. Defaults to 100. Required when consistency_level is set to BoundedStaleness.

azure_cosmosdb_account_name.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the CosmosDB Account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_cosmosdb_account_offer_type.description: (Required) Specifies the Offer Type to use for this CosmosDB Account; currently, this can only be set to Standard.

azure_resource_group_location.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_resource_group_name.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which the CosmosDB Account is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

tags.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

azure_key_vault_id.description: The ID of the Key Vault.

azure_key_vault_vault_uri.description: The URI of the Key Vault, used for performing operations on keys and secrets.

azure_key_vault_access_policy_key_permis.description: (Optional) List of key permissions. Possible values are Backup, Create, Decrypt, Delete, Encrypt, Get, Import, List, Purge, Recover, Restore, Sign, UnwrapKey, Update, Verify, WrapKey, Release, Rotate, GetRotationPolicy and SetRotationPolicy.

azure_key_vault_access_policy_secret_per.description: (Optional) List of secret permissions, must be one or more from the following: Backup, Delete, Get, List, Purge, Recover, Restore and Set.

azure_key_vault_access_policy_storage_pe.description: (Optional) List of storage permissions, must be one or more from the following: Backup, Delete, DeleteSAS, Get, GetSAS, List, ListSAS, Purge, Recover, RegenerateKey, Restore, Set, SetSAS and Update.

azure_key_vault_enabled_for_disk_encrypt.description: (Optional) Boolean flag to specify whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.

azure_key_vault_name.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Key Vault. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. The name must be globally unique. If the vault is in a recoverable state then the vault will need to be purged before reusing the name.

azure_key_vault_purge_protection_enabled.description: (Optional) Is Purge Protection enabled for this Key Vault?

azure_key_vault_sku_name.description: (Required) The Name of the SKU used for this Key Vault. Possible values are standard and premium.

azure_key_vault_soft_delete_retention_da.description: (Optional) The number of days that items should be retained for once soft-deleted. This value can be between 7 and 90 (the default) days.

azure_resource_group_location.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_resource_group_name.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the Key Vault. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

tags.description: Tags to assign to the Azure Key Vault.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_api_server_acce.description: (Optional) Set of authorized IP ranges to allow access to API server, e.g. [198.51.100.0/24].

azure_kubernetes_cluster_auto_scaler_pro.description: (Optional) Detect similar node groups and balance the number of nodes between them. Defaults to false.
(Optional) Expander to use. Possible values are least-waste, priority, most-pods and random. Defaults to random.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_default_node_po.description: (Optional) Should the Kubernetes Auto Scaler be enabled for this Node Pool?
(Optional) The maximum number of nodes which should exist in this Node Pool. If specified this must be between 1 and 1000.
(Optional) The minimum number of nodes which should exist in this Node Pool. If specified this must be between 1 and 1000.
(Required) The name which should be used for the default Kubernetes Node Pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
(Optional) The initial number of nodes which should exist in this Node Pool. If specified this must be between 1 and 1000 and between min_count and max_count.
(Optional) Specifies the autoscaling behaviour of the Kubernetes Cluster. Allowed values are Delete and Deallocate. Defaults to Delete.
(Required) Specifies the type of Managed Service Identity that should be configured on this Kubernetes Cluster. Possible values are SystemAssigned or UserAssigned.
(Required) The size of the Virtual Machine, such as Standard_DS2_v2. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_dns_prefix.description: (Optional) DNS prefix specified when creating the managed cluster. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_kubernetes_vers.description: (Optional) Version of Kubernetes specified when creating the AKS managed cluster. If not specified, the latest recommended version will be used at provisioning time (but won't auto-upgrade). AKS does not require an exact patch version to be specified, minor version aliases such as 1.22 are also supported. - The minor version's latest GA patch is automatically chosen in that case. More details can be found in the documentation.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_name.description: (Required) The name of the Managed Kubernetes Cluster to create. Changing this forces a new resource to be created

azure_kubernetes_cluster_private_cluster.description: (Optional) Should this Kubernetes Cluster have its API server only exposed on internal IP addresses? This provides a Private IP Address for the Kubernetes API on the Virtual Network where the Kubernetes Cluster is located. Defaults to false. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_public_network_.description: (Optional) Whether public network access is allowed for this Kubernetes Cluster. Defaults to true. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_role_based_acce.description: (Optional) Whether Role Based Access Control for the Kubernetes Cluster should be enabled. Defaults to true. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_service_princip.description: (Required) The Client ID for the Service Principal.
(Required) The Client Secret for the Service Principal.

azure_kubernetes_cluster_sku_tier.description: (Optional) The SKU Tier that should be used for this Kubernetes Cluster. Possible values are Free and Paid (which includes the Uptime SLA). Defaults to Free.

azure_resource_group_location.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_resource_group_name.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which the AKS is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

tags.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

tags_node_pool.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

vnet_address_space.description: (Required) The list of address spaces used by the virtual network.

vnet_name.description: (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created

azure_nat_gateway_idle_timeout_in_minute.description: (Optional) The idle timeout which should be used in minutes. Defaults to 4.

azure_nat_gateway_name.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the NAT Gateway. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_nat_gateway_sku_name.description: (Optional) The SKU which should be used. At this time the only supported value is Standard. Defaults to Standard.

azure_public_ip_name.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Public IP. Changing this forces a new Public IP to be created.

azure_public_ip_name_allocation_method.description: (Required) Defines the allocation method for this IP address. Possible values are Static or Dynamic.

azure_public_ip_prefix_length.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Public IP Prefix resource . Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_public_ip_prefix_name.description: (Required) Specifies the name of the Public IP Prefix resource . Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_public_ip_sku.description: (Optional) The SKU of the Public IP. Accepted values are Basic and Standard. Defaults to Basic. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_public_ip_sku_tier.description: (Optional) The SKU Tier that should be used for the Public IP. Possible values are Regional and Global. Defaults to Regional. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_resource_group_location.description: (Required) The location/region where the virtual network is created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_resource_group_name.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_vnet_address_space.description: (Required) The address space that is used the virtual network. You can supply more than one address space.

azure_vnet_dns_servers.description: (Optional) List of IP addresses of DNS servers

azure_vnet_name.description: (Required) The name of the virtual network. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_vnet_private_subnet_address_prefix.description: (Required) The address prefix to use for the subnet.

azure_vnet_private_subnet_security_group.description: (Optional) The Network Security Group to associate with the subnet. (Referenced by id, ie. azurerm_network_security_group.example.id)

azure_vnet_public_subnet_address_prefixe.description: (Required) The address prefix to use for the subnet.

tags.description: Tags to assign to the bucket.

nsg_id.description: The value of the NSG ID

azure_network_security_group_name.description: Name of the Network Security Group

azure_network_security_group_name_nsg_ru.description: The values for each NSG rule inbound
The values for each NSG rule outbound

tags.description: Tags to assign to the security groups.

storage_account_id.description: The ID of the storage account.

azure_resource_group_location.description: (Required) Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_resource_group_name.description: (Required) The name of the resource group in which to create the storage account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

azure_storage_access_tier.description: (Optional) Defines the access tier for BlobStorage, FileStorage and StorageV2 accounts. Valid options are Hot and Cool, defaults to Hot.

azure_storage_account_account_kind.description: (Optional) Defines the Kind of account. Valid options are BlobStorage, BlockBlobStorage, FileStorage, Storage and StorageV2. Defaults to StorageV2.

azure_storage_account_blob_properties_de.description: (Optional) Specifies the number of days that the blob should be retained, between 1 and 365 days. Defaults to 7.

azure_storage_account_blob_properties_ve.description: (Optional) Is versioning enabled? Default to false.

azure_storage_account_enable_https_traff.description: (Optional) Boolean flag which forces HTTPS if enabled, see here for more information. Defaults to true.

azure_storage_account_min_tls_version.description: (Optional) The minimum supported TLS version for the storage account. Possible values are TLS1_0, TLS1_1, and TLS1_2. Defaults to TLS1_2 for new storage accounts.

azure_storage_account_network_rules_defa.description: (Required) Specifies the default action of allow or deny when no other rules match. Valid options are Deny or Allow.

azure_storage_account_network_rules_ip_r.description: (Required) Specifies the default action of allow or deny when no other rules match. Valid options are Deny or Allow.

azure_storage_account_replication_type.description: (Required) Defines the type of replication to use for this storage account. Valid options are LRS, GRS, RAGRS, ZRS, GZRS and RAGZRS. Changing this forces a new resource to be created when types LRS, GRS and RAGRS are changed to ZRS, GZRS or RAGZRS and vice versa.

azure_storage_account_tier.description: (Required) Defines the Tier to use for this storage account. Valid options are Standard and Premium. For BlockBlobStorage and FileStorage accounts only Premium is valid. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

tags.description: Tags to assign to the storage account.
